properties.areaDesc: Oakland; St. Clair; Lapeer; Saginaw; Macomb; Shiawassee; Livingston; Genesee
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 7 at 9:07PM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
WEATHER...

* Dropping temperatures ranging between 31 and 33 degrees may
cause residual moisture from current snow activity to freeze
and produce patchy slick spots on untreated roadways.

* Widely varying snowfall is expected. Quick snow accumulations
of up to 1 inch will be possible under heaviest snow activity.

* Brief but rapid reduction of visibilities down to a half-mile
or less expected under moderate to heavy snow showers.

IMPACTS...

* The freezing of residual moisture on roadways may result in
patchy slick spots, particularly on bridges, exit ramps and
overpasses.

* Reductions of visibility to less than a half-mile are expected
under the sporadic moderate to heavy snow showers.
properties.instruction:
* Motorists are urged to use caution and account for variable
driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time.

* Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP

NWSheadline: CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR PATCHY ICING OF ROADWAYS AND BRIEF BUT RAPID REDUCTIONS OF VISIBILITIES LATE TONIGHT
